newsitem.title: USA: S.C. Electric & Gas gets OK to lower rate.
newsitem.headline: S.C. Electric & Gas gets OK to lower rate.

text.p: South Carolina Electric & Gas Co said Wednesday that state regulators have approved a decrease in natural gas rates.
The change will be effective the first billing cycle of November.
The company's factor was reduced to $.42800 per therm from $.43081 per therm, which translates to an average annual savings of $1.69 for a customer who uses 600 therms per year.
The approval was part of the South Carolina Public Service Commission's annual review of the company's purchased gas recovery procedures and gas purchasing policies.
